title: About
text:
Toronto, ON · chay.park@mail.utoronto.ca · LinkedIn





HBSc Mathematics, Economics, and Statistics
Toronto, ON
September 2021 - December 2024






Programming Languages: R, Python, SQL, HTML, CSS, MATLAB
Software Tools and Platforms: Figma, GA4, Redash, databricks, Hotjar, beusable, GitHub, Kaggle





First Aid & CPR/AED level C Certified - Canadian Red Cross







Assistant Product Manager
On-site - Seoul, S.Korea
Apr 2023 - Nov 2023

Developed, implemented, and maintained production timelines across multiple departments.
Appraised new product ideas and strategized appropriate go-to-market plans.
Facilitated Scrum, Kanban, and Agile methodologies to enhance KPIs.
Conducted market research to identify competitors for benchmarking and appropriate marketing platforms for advertising.
Monitored marketing expenses and adjusted strategies based on performance.
Utilized various analytical tools to monitor business trends and user behaviors.
Proposed UI/UX designs to highlight products and potentially increase sales.
Engaged in UX writing.
Contacted sales leads, scheduled meetings across different time zones, kept track of records, and took meeting notes.






Research Assistant
Remote - Montréal, QC
May 2021 - August 2021

Conducted literature reviews and synthesized research findings.
Assisted in research studies including data collection and analysis.
Transcribed interviews and highlighted extracts using Audacity.






CO-OP Project Intern & Junior Product Manager
Remote - Montréal, QC
January 2021 - August 2021

Managed project timelines and milestones.
Developed product requirements and user stories.
Conducted research on makerspace usage and community outreach.









R, GitHub, Posit Cloud

Thorough Replication: Replicated ‘The Puzzle of Falling US Birth Rates since the Great Recession’ (Kearney, Levine & Pardue, 2022).

Extension of Previous Research: Extending the analysis to explore additional socio-economic factors.





R, GitHub, Posit Cloud

Insight into Crime Trends and Pandemic Impact: Explored the dynamics of crime trends in Toronto from 2014 to 2022, emphasizing the correlation between the COVID-19 pandemic and variations in crime rates.
Comprehensive Data Analysis Utilizing R: Demonstrated a methodological approach by employing R for data analysis.






Performed detailed bottom-up food and beverage company analysis





Applied design thinking methodology to effectively use AI to tackle the real-life insurance industry challenge






1st Place in Student Hack, Cookhouse Labs Career Connections, May 2022

Smart I-Health: Applied design thinking methodology to effectively use AI in addressing real-life insurance industry challenges.
